slides.title: IMA Statement of Ethical Practice
slides.content:
# IMA Ethics Standards

## Four Principles

| Principle | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Honesty | Truthfulness |
| Fairness | Impartiality |
| Objectivity | Unbiased judgment |
| Responsibility | Accountability |

## Four Standards

| Standard | Focus |
|----------|-------|
| Competence | Skills and knowledge |
| Confidentiality | Information protection |
| Integrity | Ethical conduct |
| Credibility | Fair reporting |

slides.title: Competence
slides.content:
# Competence Standard

## Requirements

| Duty | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Expertise | Maintain skills |
| Laws | Follow regulations |
| CPE | Continuous learning |
| Performance | Complete duties |

## Application

```
- Know your limits
- Seek help when needed
- Stay current
- Follow standards
```

## Violations

- Acting beyond competence
- Not following standards
- Failing to update skills

slides.title: Ethics Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: IMA's four standards include Competence, Confidentiality, Integrity, and?

slides.title: Confidentiality
slides.content:
# Confidentiality Standard

## Requirements

| Duty | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Protect | Keep information secure |
| Disclose | Only as authorized |
| Monitor | Subordinates' compliance |
| Avoid | Personal use of info |

## Exceptions

| When Disclosure Allowed |
|------------------------|
| Legal requirement |
| Professional duty |
| Authorized by organization |

## Violations

- Sharing confidential data
- Insider trading
- Using info for personal gain

slides.title: Integrity
slides.content:
# Integrity Standard

## Requirements

| Duty | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Mitigate conflicts | Avoid or disclose |
| Avoid activities | That discredit profession |
| Abstain | From subverting goals |
| Report | Unethical behavior |

## Conflicts of Interest

```
Personal interest vs Professional duty

Must:
- Disclose
- Recuse if necessary
- Put organization first
```

## Violations

- Undisclosed conflicts
- Accepting inappropriate gifts
- Fraudulent behavior

slides.title: Credibility
slides.content:
# Credibility Standard

## Requirements

| Duty | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Communicate | Fair and objective |
| Disclose | All relevant info |
| Disclose | Delays in info |
| Communicate | Limitations |

## Application

```
- Present information fairly
- Don't hide bad news
- Be transparent about limitations
- Timely communication
```

## Violations

- Biased reporting
- Withholding information
- Misleading presentations

slides.title: Resolving Ethical Conflicts
slides.content:
# Conflict Resolution

## IMA Guidance Steps

```
1. Review organization policies
2. Discuss with immediate supervisor
3. If unresolved, escalate
4. If still unresolved, consult IMA Ethics Helpline
5. Consider resignation as last resort
```

## Important Points

| Action | Caution |
|--------|--------|
| Document | Keep records |
| Legal counsel | When needed |
| Confidentiality | Even during conflict |

## Never

- Ignore the issue
- Retaliate
- Violate laws

slides.title: Fraud
slides.content:
# Fraud Prevention

## Fraud Triangle

```
    Opportunity
       /    \\
      /      \\
Pressure----Rationalization
```

## Types

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Asset theft | Stealing cash |
| Corruption | Bribery |
| Financial statement | Overstating revenue |

## Red Flags

- Living beyond means
- Financial difficulties
- Control weaknesses
- Unusual behavior

slides.title: Whistleblowing
slides.content:
# Reporting Violations

## When to Report

| Situation | Action |
|-----------|--------|
| Internal channels failed | External report |
| Illegal activity | Report |
| Significant harm | Report |

## Protections

| Law | Protection |
|-----|------------|
| SOX | Retaliation prohibited |
| Dodd-Frank | Financial rewards |
| State laws | Various protections |

## Considerations

- Document everything
- Seek legal advice
- Follow proper channels

slides.title: Corporate Governance
slides.content:
# Governance Role

## Management Accountant's Role

| Area | Responsibility |
|------|---------------|
| Information | Accurate reports |
| Controls | Effective systems |
| Ethics | Model behavior |
| Compliance | Follow rules |

## Tone at the Top

```
Leadership sets ethical culture

Accountants support by:
- Modeling behavior
- Reporting issues
- Maintaining controls
```
